summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 among FBI personnel and possibly other officials coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show scheduling attempts, mentions of meetings with the SDNY (Southern District of New York), and an ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) requesting a case brief.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: An unclassified conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case.

events.title: ADIC requested case brief
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief on the Epstein case at 3:30 PM, requiring a hard stop at 3:20 PM for the scheduled meeting.

events.title: Meeting with SDNY
events.description: A 2:30 PM meeting was scheduled with an unspecified individual and his team at the SDNY (Southern District of New York) on a wider variety of subjects.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating in June-July 2019 to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case via a conference call.
The scheduling involved coordination with the SDNY (Southern District of New York), indicating inter-agency collaboration.
An ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) requested a case brief on July 1, 2019, showing high-level FBI oversight of the investigation.
The email chain reveals the use of Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) from the FBI's Victim Services Division for the Epstein victim interviews.
Multiple redacted email addresses and names are present, indicating sensitive communications among law enforcement officials.
